required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Validation of the Functional Low-Vision Observer Rated Assessment (FLORA-20) for Profoundly Blind Individuals
clinical_study.official_title: A Validation of the Functional Low-Vision Observer Rated Assessment (FLORA-20) for Profoundly Blind Individuals

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to validate an observer-rated assessment titled "Functional Low-Vision Observer Rated Assessment (FLORA-20)", which comprises 20 functional vision tasks commonly performed in or around a blind individual's home environment. This study shall be carried out with individuals who have an implanted visual prosthesis device. There are no new implantations or changes to the original implant or external wearables being studied or tested. Additionally, data from the study shall not be used alter standard of care or the user's treatment options.

primary_outcome.description: Intraclass correlation coefficient (ICC) of the overall FLORA-20 scores provided by each of the assessors (in-person and remote)
ICC of the overall FLORA-20 scores provided by the same assessor, assessed and re-assessed at two different time points

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Average Performance, ON vs. OFF
secondary_outcome.description: Paired t-test to determine if there is a statistically significant improvement in average performance from ON vs. OFF
Cohen's d calculation of overall FLORA-20 scores between device ON vs. OFF
Cronbach's alpha of the individual FLORA-20 task scores
Item-total correlations for each FLORA-20 task

study_pop.textblock: Up to 30 users with the Argus II or Orion system from the US will be enrolled.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects implanted with the Argus II or Orion device
- Subjects able to understand the written informed consent and willing to participate as evidenced by signing the informed consent
- Subject is able to follow instructions and comply with FLORA-20 scheduling and completion of tasks
- Subject is willing to be filmed while performing the FLORA-20 tasks during the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject is unsuitable for study participation as determined by Investigator's clinical judgment (with Sponsor's final input).
